com.github.dm.jrt.core.common

Class BackoffBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.core.common.BackoffBuilder

  • public class BackoffBuilder
extends Object
    A builder of backoff instances.
    This class is useful to build a backoff policy, returning a delay in milliseconds to apply when a counter exceeds a specified limit.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 05/10/2016.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff
      Base backoff policy implementation.

      • noDelay

        @NotNull
public static BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff noDelay()
        Returns the no delay backoff instance.
        The backoff will always return NO_DELAY.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.

      • constantDelay

        @NotNull
public BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff constantDelay(long value,
                                                         @NotNull
                                                         TimeUnit unit)
        Returns a constant backoff.
        The backoff will always return the specified delay.
        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.

      • exponentialDelay

        @NotNull
public BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff exponentialDelay(long value,
                                                            @NotNull
                                                            TimeUnit unit)
        Returns an exponentially increasing backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed as: delay * 2^(count - 1).
        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.

      • exponentialDelay

        @NotNull
public BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff exponentialDelay(@NotNull
                                                            DurationMeasure delay)
        Returns an exponentially increasing backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed as: delay * 2^(count - 1).
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.

      • jitterDelay

        @NotNull
public BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff jitterDelay(long value,
                                                       @NotNull
                                                       TimeUnit unit)
        Returns a de-correlated jitter backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed by taking in consideration the previous jitter delay.

        Note that this particular implementation tries to scale the maximum jitter on the count value.

        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.

      • jitterDelay

        @NotNull
public BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff jitterDelay(@NotNull
                                                       DurationMeasure delay)
        Returns a de-correlated jitter backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed by taking in consideration the previous jitter delay.

        Note that this particular implementation tries to scale the maximum jitter on the count value.

        Parameters:
        delay - the delay.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.

      • linearDelay

        @NotNull
public BackoffBuilder.BaseBackoff linearDelay(long value,
                                                       @NotNull
                                                       TimeUnit unit)
        Returns an linearly increasing backoff.
        The backoff will return a delay computed as: delay * count.
        Parameters:
        value - the delay value.
        unit - the delay unit.
        Returns:
        the backoff instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is negative.
